publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1858 Mrs Mary Mulligan: Closure of Motorola Plant—That the Parliament views with dismay the announcement of the closure of the Motorola Plant in Bathgate, with the loss of over three thousand jobs; urges the Scottish Executive to discuss with the company any measures which may minimise the effects of this decision on the individuals and communities affected; recognises the efforts of unions, staff representatives, local politicians and Ministers over the past few weeks, and calls upon the Executive to offer every support possible to West Lothian Council and neighbouring councils in their efforts to provide assistance and advice to those workers who are affected. Supported by: Bristow Muldoon*, Karen Whitefield*, Bill Butler*, Maureen Macmillan*, Hugh Henry*, Rhoda Grant*, Mr John Home Robertson*, Marilyn Livingstone*, Tommy Sheridan*, Mr Duncan McNeil*, Dr Sylvia Jackson*, Mr Michael McMahon*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, David McLetchie*, Margaret Smith*, Margaret Jamieson*
